nameStatus.register: Check availability of an Ethereum Name
nameStatus.namesRegisteredForMinimumAmount:
%s percent
names registered for minimum amount
nameStatus.medianPricePaid:
%s ether
median price paid per disputed name
nameStatus.auctionsAreSemiPrivate: Auctions are semi private: they are only seen by those who know the name. Some popular domains are therefore identifiable, but secret names are kept private until the owner decides to become public.
nameStatus.beforeANamesIsGranted: Before a name is granted, all names go to a week long wait to see if anyone else wants the name. If no other candidate appears, then the name is granted by locking 0.01 ether.
nameStatus.namesAreTemporarilyLimited: Names are temporarily limited to 7 characters or more. This limit will be reduced at some point in the future.
nameStatus.inValidateDescription: But wait! Someone has accidentally registered this name. Invalidate it and you'll get 50% of their refund.
nameStatus.invalidatorFee: will be paid to the first to report this invalid name
nameStatus.waitingForBidsToBeRevealed: %s waiting for bids to be revealed
nameStatus.afterAuctionEndsIts72h: After an auction ends its 72h period of bidding, all bidders have 48h to reveal their bids or forfeit their whole deposit. During this period, no new bids can be made. If no bids are revealed, the name can be requested again after this period ends.
nameStatus.theNameWasRegistered: This name was registered at %s. Owner offered to pay up to %s ether.
nameStatus.finalizedByTheOwner: Before any changes can be done to the name, this name needs to be finalized by the owner which will send them a refund %s ether to the owner.

explainerBody.description1: This app allows you to register a .eth domain name, for use in ethereum decentralized applications and compatible blockchain browsers. Names are not bought from any particular organization and there is no central entity receiving any funds for this, all ether spent on this app that isn't being used to pay transactions fees is either temporarily locked or burned.
explainerBody.description2: To claim a name, you must be willing to lock some amount of ether for at least a year, after which you can get the ether back by releasing the name. The process takes a week and the name will go to the account that values the name the most and is willing to lock more for it (minimum of 0.01). After names are owned, they will be controlled only by their owners, which will be able to transfer or release them, until it needs to be renewed. The contract is expected to be upgraded in 2018 to create small renewal costs, to discourage long term squatting and gold-rushing.

noNode.doesNotSupport: Your Browser does not support Smart Contracts
noNode.description: You read from the Ethereum blockchain, but in order to interact with it from your browser, download an Ethereum enabled browser like Mist, Parity or install the Metamask Chrome Extension.

open.whatIsENS1: Names in Ethereum are used to send ether, to access apps and other future uses. Names are not "bought" from anyone, ownership is guaranteed by willingness to lock ether for at least a year on the domain. While the ether is locked, the owner retains the rights to the domain, including the right to add extradata, create subdomains, lease, loan, sell it or do anything with another smart contract. The full process takes seven days and the amount of ether to be locked will be decided by auction. If nobody tries to claim your name in the first week, then you'll be refunded all the funds other than the minimum amount of 0.01 ether, required.
open.whatIsENS2: After at minimum a year, the owner can release the name back to the market and therefore recover their funds. When the permanent registrar is deployed, owners will have the right to choose to move their names to the new registrar or get their ether back. The permanent registrar will most probably include rules that might require further locking of ether, in order to make sitting on an inactive domain unprofitable.
open.understandDescription: how the process works and my risks and responsibilities involved
open.youOpenBids: You open bids on an auction that isn't open. Either an error occurred opening the auction, or the auction ended without any bids. In either case, you must open the auction again to validate your bid.

auction.aboutToGoInTheRevealPhase: About to go in the reveal phase in a few minutes, bidding is closed
auction.attention: Attention: Once the reveal phase has begun, you will have 48 hours to reveal your bid. Failing to do so will result in irreversible loss of funds. Revealing requires information stored in your browser; export your bids to make a backup of this.

bid.topBidderPayAtMostEther: You are willing to pay at most: %s ether for this name. You are still the top bidder.
bid.topBidderRefundedToTheDepositor: This bid was revealed, %s ether were refunded to the depositor.
bid.notTopBidderPayAtMostEther: You were willing to pay at most: %s ether but since someone else was willing to pay more, your full deposit was returned, minus a bidding fee of %s ether which was burned.
bid.payAndDeposite: You were willing to pay at most %s ether and deposited %s ether.
bid.payEther: You are willing to pay at most: %s ether
bid.willRefundedWhenYouReveal: %s ether will refunded when you reveal your bid

owned.description1: This name was registered at %s. Owner offered to pay up to %s ether.
owned.deedValueIsMin: No other bid was above the minimum of 0.01 ether.
owned.recordsAreNotEnabled: Records are not enabled for this name (no resolver found).
owned.basicResolver: A resolver is a contract that can answer queries about your domain. You can choose any resolver but at the moment we deployed a basic resolver that can answer about ethereum addresses and content hashes.
owned.transferOwnership: Transfer ownership of %s to another account
owned.accountToTransfer: Account to transfer the name to:
owned.releaseDescription: If you don't want to hold this name anymore, you can release it and get %s ether back.
owned.dontWantToHoldThisName: If you don't want to hold this name anymore, you'll be able to release it in %s and get %s ether back.
owned.expiredBidsAreBurned: You have a bid, but did not reveal in time. Expired bids are burned, and you can only be refunded 0.1%.
owned.etherLockedInThisName: %s ether locked in this name
owned.etherStillHeldInThisName: %s ether still held in this name

backup.title: Backup your bids
backup.description: Your bids are sealed with a secret to protect their anonymity, so you need that key to reveal. Backing the bids up allows you to restore them in case of data loss. Only the bidding account can reveal it, so make sure you that's safe too.
backup.noBidsFound: No bids found. You can still download data that might be used to recover lost bids in the future

restore.title: Import Bids
restore.description: This allows you to reveal bids made in other computers. Your current bids won't get removed.
restore.noNewBids: No new bids found for importing

reportStatus.disconnected: Ethereum network is disconnected. Awaiting connection...
